intro: Geonoma polyclada, commonly known as the clustered arrowroot, is a member of the Marantaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its upright, sometimes branched stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The leaves are typically arranged in a rosette pattern and are often a striking green with a waxy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually clustered in inflorescences. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage.
